titleStmt.title: Rich. Flecknoe's ænigmatical characters being rather a new work, than new impression of the old.
titleStmt.author: Flecknoe, Richard, d. 1678?

editionStmt.edition: This text is an enriched version of the TCP digital transcription A39707 of text R2089 in the English Short Title Catalog (Wing F1214). Textual changes and metadata enrichments aim at making the text more computationally tractable, easier to read, and suitable for network-based collaborative curation by amateur and professional end users from many walks of life. The text has been tokenized and linguistically annotated with MorphAdorner. The annotation includes standard spellings that support the display of a text in a standardized format that preserves archaic forms ('loveth', 'seekest'). Textual changes aim at restoring the text the author or stationer meant to publish.

respStmt.resp: This text has not been fully proofread

fileDesc.extent: Approx. 125 KB of XML-encoded text transcribed from 61 1-bit group-IV TIFF page images.

This Phase I text is available for reuse, according to the terms of Creative Commons 0 1.0 Universal . The text can be copied, modified, distributed and performed, even for commercial purposes, all without asking permission.
